title: Sevilla prepare new contract for Jorge Sampaoli amid Barcelona interest and €1.5million release clause
text:
Sport Sevilla prepare new contract for Jorge Sampaoli amid Barcelona interest and €1.5million release clause The Argentine coach is top of Barcelona's wishlist to replace Luis Enrique and is available in the summer for a bargain price Share The Argentine coach has been taking Spain by storm (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Share Get FC Barcelona   
Sevilla coach Jorge Sampaoli tops Barcelona’s list of potential Luis Enrique replacements - and has a meagre €1.5million release clause in his contract. 
The Argentine coach has led three-time back-to-back Europa League winners into La Liga title contention this season, his first in European football. 
His side face Premier League champions Leicester in the last 16 of the Champions League this week, and their attractive, all-action attacking style has earned Sampaoli a host of plaudits across the continent. 
And with Luis Enrique coming under increasing pressure in Catalunya, Sampaoli has been pinpointed by some members of the Camp Nou hierarchy as his replacement this summer Sampaoli with Mascherano and Neymar during Sevilla vs Barcelona in November (Photo: Getty Images) Pressure continues to grow on the Barca boss (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Champions League preview: 5 stories to watch this week 
Sampaoli, who joined Sevilla last summer having led Chile to the Copa America glory the previous year, is under contract at the Ramon Sanchez Pizjuan until 2018. 
But Los Nervionenses are now preparing to hand him an improved deal, to ward off suitors who can pinch him for a knockdown price this summer 
"We want Sampaoli to remain here,” declared Sevilla president Jose Castro, speaking on Cadena SER on Monday night. 
"His attacking game makes us happy. Sevilla have offered him another year.” Sampaoli has made a big impact in Seville (Photo: David Ramos) Sevilla president Jose Castro, with the Europa League trophy in 2015 (Photo: Martin Rose) 
Sampaoli last week refused to rule out a potential switch to Camp Nou, with pressure mounting on Luis Enrique after last week’s 4-0 thumping by Paris Saint-Germain. 
"My mind is focused on continuing to work every day to consolidate an idea here, in the club that brought me to Europe,” said Sampaoli. 
"It is clear that this profession is about the present and the reality, and the reality now is to strive for this club. Tomorrow, you never know." poll loading Should Barcelona ditch Luis Enrique for Jorge Sampaoli? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
